Description: Results of soil campaign in Fendt, JFC-1, June 2018: locations (locations.txt), moisture, bulk density (theta_grav_BD_cylinder.txt). Soil Organic Matter and Lattice Water (OM_LW_composite.txt) for composite samples. FDR-measurements and their conversion to soil moisture (voltage_epsilon_theta_FDR.txt).

Citation.Info: These files are part of the dataset published with the data-paper mentioned below.
Citation.cite-as: Fersch, B., Francke, T., Heistermann, M., Schrön, M., Döpper, V., Jakobi, J. et. al (2020, subm.): A dense network of cosmic-ray neutron sensors for soil moisture observation in a pre-alpine catchment in Germany. Earth System Science  Data, submitted. DOI:

Remarks:
Primary lab analysis (theta_grav_BD_cylinder.txt) conducted at KIT GAP, c/o Ralf Kiese.
				Secondary analysis for organic matter and lattice water using composite samples  (OM_LW_texture_composite.txt) conducted at University of Potsdam, c/o Lena Scheiffele ,Yannick Heidrich, Sandra Szulc-Seyfried, Heide Kraudelt. 
				Particle size classes according to WRB (coarse > 2 mm, sand > 0.063 mm, silt > 0.002 mm, clay < 0.002 mm).
				FDR-measurements converted to soil moisture (voltage_epsilon_theta_FDR.txt) using process_fdr.R (adjusted equation by Zhao et al. 2016 using FDR2soilmoisture-package) by Till Francke. Sensor locations have been surveyed using dGPS (locations.txt).
				All data disassembled from theta_sheet_converted2_converted.xlsx.
